com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com tom turkey pattern pattern difficulty medium i assume you already know how to crochet how to crochet in the round how to read a pattern and how to sew pieces together supplies size g hook scraps of worsted weight yarn red heart super saver works nicely  buff beige  medium brown  burgundy red  yellow  black gauge is unimportant for this project terms chain = chain single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half-double_crochet blo = back loops only increase = increase two single_crochet in same stitch decrease = decrease crochet two stitches together *random words* around = repeat what s between the * s until you run out of stitches note my critters are worked in the round i join rounds and i single_crochet in the same space as joining so i m assuming that at the end of each round you are slip stitching to the first stitch of that round and that you chain 1 to start the next round you can work in spirals if that s easier for you just remember to mark your rounds you want your stitches tight and close together so the stuffing doesn t show through later on to start each piece you can chain 2 and work your 6 stitches into the 2nd stitch from the hook or you can use the magic_ring be creative and have fun page 2 of 10 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com head row instruction stitches 1 starting with black yarn 6 chain 2 6 single_crochet in second chain from hook join w/ a slip_stitch chain 1 2 *2 single_crochet in each single_crochet* around 12 3 *single_crochet in next single_crochet increase in next single_crochet* around 18 4 *single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet* around 24 5 in
